tuv.seg: Nullity of marriage is a declaration by a court that your supposed marriage is null and void, and that no valid marriage exists between you and your partner
Is dearbhú ó chúirt é neamhniú pósta go bhfuil do phósadh a bhí in ainm agus a bheith ann ar neamhní agus gan éifeacht agus nach bhfuil aon phósadh bailí ag feidhmiú idir tú féin agus do pháirtnéir
In other words, it is a declaration that the supposed marriage never happened
I bhfriotal eile, is dearbhú atá ann nár tharla an pósadh a bhí in ainm agus a bheith ann riamh
Nullity (or annulment) is not the same as divorce
Ní hionann ‘neamhniú (nó neamhniú pósta’) agus colscaradh
Divorce is a declaration ending a valid marriage
Is ionann colscaradh agus dearbhú a chuireann deireadh le pósadh bailí
Nullity is a declaration that a valid marriage never existed
Is ionann neamhniú agus dearbhú nárbh ann do phósadh bailí riamh
It is important to be aware that a church annulment does not have any legal effect
Is tábhachtach a bheith ar an airdeall nach mbíonn aon tionchar dlíthiúil ag neamhniú séipéil
It does not mean that you may legally remarry - although it may mean that you can remarry in the eyes of the church
Ní chiallaíonn sé gur féidir libh athphósadh go dlíthiúil – cé go mb’fhéidir go bhféadfadh sibh athphósadh de réir na heaglaise
In nullity law, there are two types of marriages that may be annulled or cancelled
Sa dlí infheidhme, tá dhá shaghas de phostaí ann ar féidir iad a chur ar neamhní nó a chealú
There are void marriages and there are voidable marriages
Tá póstaí ar neamhní agus tá póstaí in-neamhnithe ann
If your marriage is void, it is regarded as never having taken place
Má tá do phósadh ar neamhní, meastar nár tharla sé riamh
Technically, if your marriage never took place, then there is no need to go to court to obtain a decree of annulment - you may simply act as though the marriage never happened
Go teicniúil, murar thit bhur bpósadh amach riamh, níl aon ghá dul a fhad leis an gcúirt chun foraithne neamhnithe a fháil – féadfaidh tú gníomhú go simplí ar nós nár tharla an pósadh riamh
However, it is advisable to obtain a court order declaring that your marriage is annulled in order to remove any doubt
Moltar duit ordú cúirte a fháil ina ndearbhaíonn tú gur cuireadh do phósadh ar neamhní d’fhonn aon amhras a bhaint
If your marriage is voidable, it is considered to be a valid marriage until a decree of annulment is made
Má tá bhur bpósadh in-neamhnithe, meastar gurb ionann agus pósadh bailí é go dtí go ndéantar foraithne neamhnithe
A decree of annulment can only be made if one of the parties to the marriage applies to the court for a nullity
Ní féidir foraithne neamhnithe a dhéanamh ach amháin má dhéanann duine de na páirtithe leis an bpósadh iarratas ar an gcúirt ar neamhniú
If the court decides that your marriage is voidable, it will then declare that your marriage was invalid from the start
Má chineann an chúirt go bhfuil bhur bpósadh in-neamhnithe, dearbhóidh sí go raibh bhur bpósadh ar neamhní ón tús
Your marriage never happened
Níor tharla bhur bpósadh riamh
You can find out about the implications of a decree of nullity in our document on the consequences of civil annulment of your marriage
Féadfaidh tú teacht ar eolas faoi na himpleachtaí a bhaineann le foraithne neamhnithe inár gcáipéis maidir le hiarmhairtí neamhniú sibhialta bhur bpósta
In order to obtain an annulment (nullity) of your alleged marriage, you must make an application (called a 'petition') to the Circuit Court or the High Court
Chun neamhniú bhur bpósta líomhnaithe a fháil, ní mór duit iarratas a dhéanamh (ar a dtugtar ‘achainí’) leis an gCúirt Chuarda nó leis an Ard-Chúirt
To prove to the court that your marriage is void you must show one of the following grounds:
Lena chruthú don chúirt go bhfuil bhur bpósadh ar neamhní, ní mór duit ceann amháin de na forais a leanas a thaispeáint:
• At the time of the marriage ceremony there was a lack of capacity
• Ag tráth an tsearmanais phósta, bhí easpa cumais ann
In other words, you or your spouse was incapable of entering into a binding contract
I bhfriotal eile, ní raibh ar do chumas féin nó ar chumas do chéile iontráil i gconradh ceangailteach
- where one of you was already validly married or in a civil partnership or
- sa chás go raibh duine díobh pósta nó i bpáirtnéireacht shibhialta cheana féin nó
- where you were too closely related to each other or
- sa chás go raibh gaol ró-dhlúth eadraibh nó
- for a marriage ceremony that took place before 16 November 2015, where you were of the same biological sex
- i gcás searmanas pósta a thit amach roimh 16 an Samhain 2015, má bhí sibh den ghnéas céanna bitheolaíoch
• The formal requirements for a marriage ceremony were not followed
• Níor leanadh na ceanglais fhoirmiúla do shearmanas pósta
For example, you did not give due notice to the Registrar of Marriages
Mar shampla, níor thug tú fógra cuí don Chláraitheoir Póstaí
• At the time of the marriage, there was a lack of consent
• Ag tráth an phósta, bhí easpa toilithe ann
In other words, you or your spouse did not give free and fully informed consent to the marriage
I bhfriotal eile, níor thug tú féin nó do chéile toiliú saor agus iomlán feasach don phósadh
This may be due to duress, (i.e., you were forced into the marriage), mistake, misrepresentation or fraud
B’fhéidir go bhfuil seo i ngeall ar éigeantas (i.e., cuireadh brú ort pósadh), ar bhotún, ar mhífhaisnéis nó ar chalaois
It may also be due to the fact that you or your spouse was suffering from a mental illness or was intoxicated at the time of the marriage
Anuas air sin, b’fhéidir go bhfuil seo i ngeall go raibh tú féin nó do chéile thíos le meabhairghalar nó go raibh sé/sí faoi thionchar an óil ag tráth an phósta
To prove to the court that your marriage is voidable, you must show one of the following grounds:
Lena chruthú don chúirt go bhfuil bhur bpósadh in-neamhnithe, ní mór duit ceann amháin de na forais a leanas a thaispeáint:
• At the time of the marriage ceremony, either party was impotent
• Ag tráth an tsearmanais phósta, bhí ceachtar páirtí éagumasach
You must show that either you or your spouse was unable to consummate the marriage
Ní mór duit a thaispeáint nach raibh ar chumas tú féin nó do chéile an pósadh a chur i gcrích

You cannot obtain a declaration of nullity because one of you is infertile or because one of you is simply refusing to consummate the marriage. It must be the case that one of you is incapable of sexual intercourse

Ní mór duit dearbhú neamhnithe a fháil mar gheall go bhfuil duine díobh neamhthorthúil nó mar gheall go bhfuil duine díobh ag diúltú chun an pósadh a neamhniú Ní mór gurb éard atá i gceist ná nach bhfuil ar chumas duine díobh tabhairt faoi chaidreamh collaí
• At the time of the marriage ceremony, either party was incapable of entering into and sustaining a proper or normal marriage relationship
• Ag tráth an tsearmanais phósta, ní raibh ar chumas ceachtar páirtí iontráil i gcaidreamh ceart pósta nó i ngnáthchaidreamh pósta a iontráil nó a chothabháil
This may be due to a psychiatric illness or personality disorder
D’fhéadfadh galar síciatrach nó neamhord pearsantachta a bheith i gceist leis seo
It may also be due to the sexual orientation of one of the parties
Chomh maith leis sin, mar gheall ar ghnéaschlaonadh duine de na páirtithe
Legal advice and representation is always advisable
Moltar i gcónaí duit comhairle agus ionadaíocht dhlíthiúil a fháil
You and your spouse should not use the same solicitor
Níor cheart duit féin nó do chéile an t-aturnae céanna a úsáid
To enquire whether you are eligible for Legal Aid, you can contact your nearest law centre
Lena fhiosrú cé acu an bhfuil nó nach bhfuil tú i dteideal Cúnamh Dlíthiúil a fháil, féadfaidh tú teagmháil a dhéanamh leis an ionad dlí is gaire duit
Legal Aid is not free and everyone must pay a contribution towards costs
Níl Cúnamh Dlíthiúil saor in aisce agus ní mór do gach duine ranníocaíocht a íoc i dtreo costas
FLAC (Free Legal Advice Centres) is an independent, voluntary organisation that operates a network of legal advice clinics throughout the country
Eagraíocht neamhspleách dheonach iad ICDSanna (Ionaid Chomhairle Dlí Saor in Aisce) a oibríonn gréasáin de chlinicí comhairle dlíthiúla ar fud na tíre
These clinics are confidential, free of charge and open to all
Tá na clinicí seo rúnda, saor in aisce agus oscailte do chách
Contact your nearest Citizens Information Centre for information on FLAC services in your area
Déan teagmháil leis an Ionad um Fhaisnéis do Shaoránaigh chun teacht ar fhaisnéis faoi sheirbhísí ICDSanna i do cheantar
FLAC also runs an information and referral line during office hours for basic legal information
Tá seirbhís faisnéise agus líne atreoraithe á reáchtáil i rith uaireanta oifige le haghaidh faisnéis dhlíthiúil bhunúsach
If you choose to hire a private solicitor, you should be aware that there is no fixed rate of charges for legal fees
Má roghnaíonn tú chun aturnae príobháideach a fhostú, ba cheart duit a bheith ar an eolas nach bhfuil aon ráta seasta de mhuirir ann le haghaidh muirir dhlíthiúla
You are advised to obtain some quotes before deciding on a legal firm
Moltar duit roinnt cuótaí a fháil a fháil sula ndéanann tú cinneadh ar ghnóthas dlíthiúil
Contact information for solicitors firms throughout Ireland is available on the Law Society website
Tá faisnéis teagmhála le haghaidh gnóthais aturnaetha ar fáil ar fud na hÉireann ar láithreán gréasáin Dhlí-Chumann na hÉireann
Further information on applying is available on the Courts Service website
Tá breis faisnéise ar fáil ar iarratas a dhéanamh ar láithreán gréasáin na Seirbhíse Cúirteanna
